abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings assess the project as
            satisfactory, sustainability as likely, and institutional
            development impacts as substantial. Lessons address the
            importance of continuity in project leadership, and staff,
            for although the project suffered during preparation, and
            implementation due to the constant changes of the Director
            of the Tax Department, the continuity of top officials in
            the General Directorate of Taxes (GDT), benefited project
            outcomes. In addition, partly due to the lack of support by
            the Ministry of Finance, the work of the Project
            Implementation Unit could have been seriously hampered, had
            it not been for its valuable professional staff, who were
            able to assist GDT implement the last phase of the project,
            including international competitive bidding, under severe
            constraints. This leads to GDT management levels, where
            priorities should be carefully managed, so as to ensure
            that, given the limited human, and financial resources, the
            most important activities are implemented. Nonetheless, the
            project scope rightly focused on the implementation of the
            new functional organization, and on procedures for a single
            tax - the Value Added Tax (VAT) - to prod the success of GDT
            by limiting the objectives, but retaining its capacity as
            the new tax administrator, and, certainly the Bank's
            approval on the use of cost savings to expand VAT systems,
            allowed GDT to test its own (successful) managerial
            capacity. However, incentives to retain qualified personnel,
            be it training, or enhanced challenging work, remain essential.

Albania - Tax Administration Modernization

display_title.display_title:
Albania - Tax Administration
            Modernization Project : Credit 2646 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

18153557.admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia

abstracts.cdata!:
The Tax Administration Modernization
            Project's objective is to assist the authorities to
            sustain and enhance revenue collection in the short-term and
            to improve tax and customs administration in the long-run.
            This objective is to be achieved by institutional and
            technological strengthening of administrative units in
            charge of national taxes.  The strategy includes defining
            the roles of the various entities, the collection and
            taxpayer auditing areas, the improvement of taxpayer
            services for the current tax structure, preparation for the
            implementation of the value added tax (VAT), as well as
            measures to improve the efficiency of the Customs
            Directorate.  The project has five major components:  (a)
            technical cooperation to implement the short/medium-term
            measures to sustain revenue collection, and to reorganize
            the tax and customs administrations; (b) technical
            cooperation for the development and implementation of a VAT
            that would replace the current turnover tax in 1995; (c)
            technical cooperation for the setting up of two pilot units
            to implement a computer-based system for monitoring
            compliance with basic tax obligations; (d) training for both
            tax and customs officers; and (e) purchase of vehicles,
            equipment and materials and any necessary refurbishing of
            buildings to accommodate the equipment for both tax and
            customs directorates.
